akn:section.akn:heading: Recognition and enforcement of foreign arbitral decisions and awards; reciprocity

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 304. Recognition and enforcement of foreign arbitral decisions and awards; reciprocity Arbitral decisions or awards made in the territory of a foreign State shall, on the basis of reciprocity, be recognized and enforced under this chapter only if that State has ratified or acceded to the Inter-American Convention. (Added Pub. L. 101–369, § 1, Aug. 15, 1990, 104 Stat. 449.)
Statutory Notes and Related Subsidiaries Effective DateSection effective upon the entry into force of the Inter-American Convention on International Commercial Arbitration of January 30, 1975, with respect to the United States (Oct. 27, 1990), see section 3 of Pub. L. 101–369, set out as a note under section 301 of this title.
